content:
The origin story of the Duulo-Vraktor bloodline was steeped in mythology and passed down through generations with reverence. It all began with Mitne, a dragon deity with iridescent rainbow scales that shone like gems in the sun's light. He was the guardian of the forest and its protector, ensuring that the delicate balance of nature was maintained. Mitne was beyond pride, with a transcendent understanding of all things. He regarded all life in the forest as equal and cherished the relationships he formed with each species.

The elves, a traditional race that lived in harmony with the forest, learned much from Mitne and valued their friendship with the dragon. They had known nothing but peace for as long as they could remember. Those who stumbled upon the forest would be awestruck by Mitne's presence, and even those with ill intentions had their hearts purified by the sight of him. The dragon's soothing voice lifted the shadows from their hearts and allowed them to see the world with fresh eyes. They heard nature's timeless song for the first time - the gentle whistle of the wind through the grass, the plink of a drop of dew hitting a rock, the rustle of leaves and petals as they were swept up and carried away.

One such person, overcome with emotion, asked Mitne how he had purged their heart of darkness. Mitne listened mindfully, closing his eyes to better hear nature's song. He replied that he had given them a taste of true divinity, which, if there was still some good in a person's heart, would cleanse all impurities. True evil was rare, but if a soul was consumed by darkness, it would cause the mind to go mad and die. In these cases, Mitne cleansed the souls and sent them on the journey of rebirth.

The man was given insight into the great order and broke down in tears, mourning the futures of those he had hurt. Mitne told him that punishment was not the answer to atonement, and that he should find his own path to divinity by filling the world with beauty and allowing others to hear nature's timeless song. The man found his resolve and walked away, determined to become someone worthy of Mitne's friendship.

Mitne eventually announced that it was time for him to leave the forest, causing sadness and shock among the various tribes that had populated the forest over the centuries. On the day of his departure, all of his friends gathered around his favorite resting spot and smiled, so that the last thing he would see before returning to the gods would be their joy. He left behind a rainbow-scaled egg, and a young diviner saw that the next forest guardian would hatch the next day.

Under the light of the moon, the youth of the forest gathered to witness the hatching of the egg. The young diviner strummed her harp, the youth played their flutes, and the forest creatures howled and roared as the egg slowly cracked, revealing a magnificent, colossal creature. Everyone was silent as the new dragon, Duulo, emerged, shining with his own unique hue.

Duulo was born with great knowledge of himself and his purpose, to continue his father's legacy of peace and protection for the forest. He shone like a rainbow, just as Mitne's scales had sparkled poetically in the sun's light. The creatures of the forest were strong and many beyond it had been saved by Mitne, and they felt indebted to the dragon and his legacy. Duulo was the next chapter in the timeless story of the Duulo-Vraktor bloodline, a shining beacon of hope and peace in the heart of the forest.
